Guwahati airport revamp to boost Northeast tourism
In a major boost to the Northeastern region tourism sector, Minister of State for Culture & Tourism (Independent Charge) Dr Mahesh Sharma, on Wednesday said the Guwahati airport is being revamped at an investment of Rs 1,200 crore to improve connectivity.
Planning to make Guwahati a point to provide better connectivity in Northeast, the minister said that a helicopter hub in association with Pawan Hans services is being created in the Assam capital.
Signalling governmentâ€™s stand on tourism promotion in Northeast region, he said that connectivity in northeast remains a high priority for the centre in order to promote tourism in this part of the country.
Other than being a tourism hub, Guwahati has also been selected among six Northeastern cities under the Development of Solar Cities Programme of the union ministry of new and renewable energy (MNRE). The six northeastern cities are Guwahati and Jorhat in Assam, Kohima and Dimapur in Nagaland, Itanagar in Arunachal Pradesh and Agartala in Tripura.
The Union Minister was speaking at the launch of curtain raiser ceremony of International Tourism mart (ITM) for the North East region which is The Union Minister was speaking at the launch of curtain raiser ceremony of International Tourism mart (ITM) for the North East region which is scheduled to take place during 14- 16 October 2015 in Gangtok.
Dr Sharma asked all stake holders from travel and tourism industry to participate in the 4th ITM to be held in Gangtok, Sikkim.
